chrome_tts_engine

Top-Level Variables
tts_engine: ChromeTtsEngine
Classes
ChromeTtsEngine

Use the chrome.ttsEngine API to implement a text-to-speech(TTS) engine using an extension. If your extension registers using this API, it will receive events containing an utterance to be spoken and other parameters when any extension or packaged app uses the tts(tts.html) API to generate speech. Your extension can then use any available web technology to synthesize and output the speech, and send events back to the calling function to report the status.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeTtsEngine tts_engine

Class ChromeTtsEngine

Fields
onPause: Stream
onResume: Stream

sendTtsEvent(int requestId, dynamic event): void

Fields

final Stream onPause
final Stream onResume
final Stream onSpeak
final Stream onStop

Getters and Setters

Stream<dynamic> get onPause

Optional: if an engine supports the pause event, it should pause the current utterance being spoken, if any, until it receives a resume event or stop event. Note that a stop event should also clear the paused state.

Stream<dynamic> get onResume

Optional: if an engine supports the pause event, it should also support the resume event, to continue speaking the current utterance, if any. Note that a stop event should also clear the paused state.

Stream<dynamic> get onSpeak

Called when the user makes a call to tts.speak() and one of the voices from this extension's manifest is the first to match the options object.

Stream<dynamic> get onStop

Fired when a call is made to tts.stop and this extension may be in the middle of speaking. If an extension receives a call to onStop and speech is already stopped, it should do nothing (not raise an error). If speech is in the paused state, this should cancel the paused state.

Methods

void sendTtsEvent(int requestId, dynamic event)

Routes a TTS event from a speech engine to a client. event The update event from the text-to-speech engine indicating the status of this utterance.
